business.headline: Budget 2026: Can India fix renewable energy's storage and reliability gap?Sustained support for storage, critical minerals and local manufacturing could help India build a self-reliant and competitive clean energy ecosystem, say experts.

Budget 2026: Why India's VDA tax framework needs a strategic recalibrationAs policymakers consider Budget 2026, it is timely to assess whether the current tax design continues to align with the framework's original objectives, given global market and regulatory developments.

India–EU FTA to strengthen jobs, and drive growth, says President MurmuThe President said that the India–EU free trade agreement would provide a strong push for the manufacturing and services sectors and help generate fresh employment opportunities for the country's youth.

How mis-selling and low surrender values are costing life insurance buyers dearlyMis-selling pulls families into long-term commitments, and low surrender values lock them in. Until these rules change, life insurance will remain a product where many lose more than they gain.

Budget 2026: Will new tax slabs ease the burden on middle-income taxpayers?As Budget 2026 approaches, middle-income taxpayers are watching closely for signs of relief. With rising costs and inflation pressures, the big question is whether the government will tweak tax slabs to ease the burden.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as mood turns positive ahead of Budget sessionThe Nifty50 closed 0.66% higher at 25,342.75, while the BSE Sensex gained 0.6% to end at 82,344.68. With this rise, both benchmark indices have added close to 1% over the last two trading sessions.

Is Budget 2026 ready to address startups' compliance, funding and tech gaps?As expectations rise ahead of Budget 2026, startup founders and investors are watching closely to see whether policy announcements will finally ease compliance pressures, unlock domestic capital and strengthen India's technology backbone.

India needs an hourly wage structure before it needs a right to disconnectA right to disconnect sounds progressive, but without a transparent hourly wage structure for white collar professionals, it may end up doing the opposite of what it intends.

8th Pay Commission: A look at real salary hikes so far and what may come nextWith the 8th Pay Commission expected to submit its recommendations in the coming months, attention has turned to the pattern of real salary hikes over the years. A look at earlier pay commissions offers useful clues about what employees may realistically expect this time.

India-EU trade deal: Why textiles could be the biggest quiet winnerThe textile sector gets immediate and meaningful relief under the free trade agreement, with changes that directly improve India's ability to compete in one of the world's largest consumer markets.

Gold is still a safe bet, but why silver is notWith markets on edge, investors are once again turning to precious metals, but not all shine equally. Gold remains a trusted store of value, while silver's recent surge has exposed its higher volatility and cyclical risks.

Gold shoots past Rs 1.62 lakh, silver eyes Rs 4 lakh: Should you buy now?Gold and silver remain firmly in an uptrend, but analysts warn the rally is getting stretched. With prices at record levels, should you buy precious metals or avoid them?
Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 593.83 points to 82,451.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 189.10 points to 25,364.50 as of 9:25 am.

Highlights: Opposition protests VB-G RAM G Act during President's address; govt slams conduct, seeks apologyBudget Session 2026 Highlights: The Budget Session in the Indian Parliament will begin today. At 11 am, Indian President Draupadi Murmu will address the joint sitting of both houses, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The opposition parties will hold a meeting around 10 am to chalk out a strategy for the budget session. The opposition parties seek a discussion on issues like the VB-G RAM-G Bill and the implementation of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR). However, the Union Minister for Minority Affairs, Kiren Rijiju, has denied all possibilities of discussions on these issues, as the topics were upheld during the winter session.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market rise today? Check hereEarly signals from the Gift Nifty suggest a firm start for the market. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,438.5 at around 8:30 AM. This points to the Nifty 50 opening above Tuesday's closing level of 25,175.4.

India-EU trade deal may not shake auto sector as much as feared. Here's whyA key part of the discussion is around import duties on cars. Under the deal, import duty on fully built imported cars, known as completely built units, could be cut sharply from around 110% to nearly 40% in the initial phase.

Shadowfax IPO listing: Will Shadowfax shares open higher or lower on BSE, NSE?Overall subscription for the Shadowfax Technologies IPO stood at 2.86 times. The retail investor category was subscribed 2.43 times, showing moderate interest from individual investors.

Budget 2026: Why investors want stability, not big surprisesOver the last few years, the government has moved decisively towards a more citizen-friendly direct tax regime, most recently visible in the new tax slabs under the reworked regime for FY 2025–26, where income up to Rs 4 lakh is now tax-free and the higher rate of 30% applies only beyond Rs 24 lakh.

India–EU trade deal a boost for long-term ties amid global uncertainty: EU VP Kaja KallasDescribed as the "mother of all deals", India–EU trade pact is expected to boost trade, lower barriers, and deepen economic ties between the two sides.

New Tax Regime explained: Key changes so far and what Budget 2026 may bringWith the core structure already in place, Budget 2026 is expected to focus on fine-tuning rather than major overhauls. The government is likely to continue strengthening the new regime as a low-tax, low-complexity option suited to a wide range of taxpayers.

entertainment.headline: Rahul Vaidya recalls Ajit Pawar's love for music, shares video from an event Rahul Vaidya shared an emotional throwback video recalling his last meeting with Ajit Pawar, where the leader requested his favourite songs during a December event.

Away from noise: Mahesh Bhatt on Arijit Singh stepping away from playback singing Mahesh Bhatt reflected on Arijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing, calling it a choice of silence and truth at the peak of his career.

Rani Mukerji's comment on gender roles ahead of Mardaani 3 sees reactions online Rani Mukerji's comment on gender roles ahead of Mardaani 3 has sparked reactions online after a clip from her interview went viral.

Vijay is not afraid: Actor's father SA Chandrasekhar on Jana Nayagan delay SA Chandrasekhar, father of Thalapathy Vijay, addressed the reasons behind the delay in Jana Nayagan's theatrical release during a recent media interaction.

Emraan Hashmi on serial kisser tag: Juiced it to the hilt, but had to reinvent Emraan Hashmi recently opened up about his "serial kisser" label, admitting he fully embraced the image for commercial success. However, the actor emphasised that constant reinvention and versatility are essential to staying relevant as audience preferences shift over the decades.

Border 2 dominates 2026 box office, trade predicts Rs 600 crore lifetime business Border 2 has crossed Rs 200 crore in just five days and is racing ahead of Dhurandhar, emerging as the biggest box-office success of 2026 so far.

Bridgerton Season 4 OTT release: When and where to watch the new episodes Bridgerton Season 4 OTT release: the new season focusing on Benedict Bridgerton's love story will stream on Netflix in two parts. Episodes 1–4 release on January 29, followed by episodes 5–8 on February 26.

Prabhas gives shoutout to Rasha Thadani for her singing debut with Chaap Tilak Prabhas gave a shout-out to Rasha Thadani for her Chaap Tilak singing debut from her upcoming film Laikey Laikaa. The movie also features Abhay Verma in a pivotal character.

Bharti Singh, Harssh Limbachiyaa announce their second baby boy's name, share pics Bharti Singh and Harssh Limbachiyaa have revealed the name of their second son, Yashveer, by sharing pictures from his namkaran ceremony on social media.

Shriya Saran: Drishyam 3 Hindi is different from the Malayalam one Shriya Saran opened up about the emotional journey of Drishyam 3. She highlighted how the Hindi version offers a unique experience different from the Malayalam original.

Rani Mukerji says 'female-centric' label needs to go: High time we change narrative Rani Mukerji urged the film industry to stop using the 'female-centric' label and focus on the quality of films. She highlighted how Mardaani inspired many women to join the police force but stresses that societal issues still need urgent attention.

Not true: Karan Wahi reacts to engagement rumours with Jennifer Winget Karan Wahi has denied reports claiming that he is engaged to his Dill Mill Gaye co-star Jennifer Winget, calling the rumours false.

Samantha–Raj Nidimoru's cute pickleball moment wins internet. Watch A video featuring Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru laughing together during a pickleball match has gone viral on social media. The two got married in December 2025.

How Rajinikanth's encouragement nudged Abishan Jeevinth into acting Abishan Jeevinth, known for his directorial debut Tourist Family, steps into acting with the romantic comedy With Love. Ahead of its release the actor-director shared the kind of encouragement he got from superstar Rajinikanth.

Emraan Hashmi recalls the day his son was diagnosed with cancer: My world flipped Emraan Hashmi opened up about the painful period when his son was diagnosed with cancer in 2014, calling it the toughest phase of his life.

Karthi's Vaa Vaathiyaar streams on Prime Video after two-week theatrical run Karthi's film Vaa Vaathiyaar, directed by Nalan Kumarasamy, is now available on Amazon Prime Video in multiple languages after a brief two-week run in theatres following its Pongal release.

Varun Dhawan re-shares Shashank Khaitan post about his tedhi smile, cleanest heart Varun Dhawan is winning praise for his performance in Border 2 after facing trolling over his "tedhi smile." Filmmaker Shashank Khaitan backed the actor, calling his performance sincere as the film continues to do well at the box office.

Wheel of Fortune India 1st impression: Akshay Kumar spins fun into classic game 'Wheel of Fortune India' may be a familiar game, but Akshay Kumar's charm gives it a fresh spin. Laughter, puzzles, and a dash of Bollywood star power make it a ride worth taking with the whole family.

Diljit Dosanjh recalls watching Border on TV as he couldn't buy theatre tickets Diljit Dosanjh recalled an emotional memory as a kid when he could not afford to buy the tickets for Sunny Deol's Border in theatre. The actor features alongside Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty and others in Border 2.

general news.headline: Steep descent, then fireball: New video shows moment Ajit Pawar's plane crashedAjit Pawar plane crash: The video shows the final moments before the crash, capturing the plane flipping, losing control, free-falling, and then hitting the ground.

Purely an accident, no politics in this: Sharad Pawar on nephew Ajit's deathIn what appeared to be a dig at the Opposition, Sharad Pawar's first public reaction since his nephew's death was an appeal to opposition parties not to politicise the tragic incident.

US-Iran tensions escalate: Trump warns of far worse attack, Iran fires backTensions between the US and Iran escalated after President Donald Trump warned Tehran of a "far worse" attack over nuclear negotiations. Iran responded by saying it is open to dialogue but will defend itself "like never before" if provoked.

India-EU trade deal: How PM Modi reached out to 27 nations with 1 messageAs India and the EU sealed theFTA, PM Modi tactfully used the diplomatic milestone to turn it into a personal outreach to millions across Europe by posting about the deal in 24 different EU languages.

Shreya Ghoshal backs Arijit Singh after playback retirement: Not the end of an eraShreya Ghoshal responded positively to Arijit Singh's announcement that he will retire from playback singing, encouraging him as he embarks on a new phase in his music career.

4th T20I Live: Shivam Dube refuses to back down in chaseIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) Live Score: The fearless approach is clearly not working for India with New Zealand's spinners making it a nightmare for India's batters in Vizag.

Why the tapes on Netanyahu's mobile phone camera?An image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu using a mobile with tapes on the camera has sparked curiosity and questions. It is known that phone cameras can be hacked to spy. People are asking if the PM of Israel, a country with access to critical spying and anti-hacking software, has to tape phones, how safe are common folks.

Mamata Banerjee hints at foul play in Ajit Pawar's death, Fadnavis hits backWest Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee hinted at foul play in the plane crash that killed Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, demanding a Supreme Court-monitored probe, drawing sharp backlash from the BJP.

Ajit Pawar's political family tree: Roots, branches, and legacyAjit Pawar belonged to one of Maharashtra's most influential political families, with deep roots in Baramati and state politics. His family includes several leaders across generations, with ties to Sharad Pawar's political dynasty.

16 killed in huge fire at Wow! Momo warehouse in Kolkata, 13 missingAccording to locals, the godown was used to store dry food. The fire spread rapidly due to the large quantity of inflammable materials like packaged dry food items and cold drink bottles stored at the site. Police sources said charred bone fragments are still present inside the building, underscoring the scale of the devastation.

Will Ajit's wife Sunetra emerge as the new Pawar centre of NCP?Ajit Pawar's death in an air crash on Wednesday has thrown the NCP into uncertainty. Attention, naturally, has shifted to Sunetra Pawar. Long seen away from frontline politics, the Rajya Sabha MP might now be at the centre of the Ajit Pawar faction. She is well-connected, has experience, and public sympathy.

Who were Captains Sumit Kapoor, Shambhavi Pathak who died in Ajit Pawar jet crash?A tragic air crash near Baramati Airport claimed the life of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and five others during a routine political trip. The incident has left the state in mourning and prompted a thorough investigation.

UGC Equity Row: Discrimination was never only about caste. But the protests areHandcrafted ByOur Editors UGC's 2026 equity regulations aim to tackle discrimination across caste, gender, disability and institutional power. Yet public protests frame them narrowly through caste. This opinion piece examines why caste dominates the debate, what the rules actually do, and what the backlash reveals about how India talks about equity.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Ajit Pawar, 4 others killed in plane crash in Baramati: What we know so farMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died in a plane crash on Wednesday morning. He was heading to Baramati to address four public meetings ahead of the Zilla Parishad elections when the crash took place.

India came out on top: US trade chief says EU deal tilts in Delhi's favourThe US trade chief has said India will emerge as the biggest beneficiary of its landmark trade deal with the EU, gaining wider market access and potentially enhanced mobility for Indian workers in Europe.

Why the red sky over Ladakh is a warning India can't ignoreThe red auroras over Hanle are a stunning visual of intense solar activity. These celestial displays are a warning for India's satellites and power grids.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Singer Chinmayi on Arijit's playback exit: He always operated from higher callingSinger Chinmayi Sripaada shared her memories of collaborating with Arijit Singh and offered her thoughts on his professionalism, following Singh's announcement to withdraw from playback singing at the peak of his career.

Final moments of Ajit Pawar's doomed plane reconstructed using flight dataIndia Today analysed flight data and pinpointed the crash site using available footage to show what happened in the final moments before the crash.

Why Ajit Pawar's plane crashed? A pilot breaks down initial detailsQuestions have now started to swirl on what might have led to the horrific plane crash involving Ajit Pawar. A senior pilot has pieced together the possible reason that might have led to the fatal crash.
Video: School bus rams grandmother carrying toddler on Mumbai road, child diesThe incident occurred when the grandmother was crossing the road in front of the bus after picking up her granddaughter.

It ain't over till it's over: How India changed the game in weeksIn weeks' time, India has changed the mood on trade deals. From being portrayed as a loser by Trump aide Howard Lutnick, New Delhi now seems to have the upper hand in India-US trade negotiations. It has finalised the India-EU FTA and will be hosting the Canadian PM in March. This after sealing an FTA with New Zealand.

8th Pay Commission: A look at real salary hikes so far and what may come nextWith the 8th Pay Commission expected to submit its recommendations in the coming months, attention has turned to the pattern of real salary hikes over the years. A look at earlier pay commissions offers useful clues about what employees may realistically expect this time.

sports.headline: IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson's Vizag T20I ends in another missed opportunity Sanju Samson's poor run of form continues as he was dismissed for 24 off 16 balls during the Vizag T20I. Samson made a good start and failed to push on and get a big score.

After T20 World Cup boycott, Bangladesh clears shooting team's India travel Despite boycotting the T20 World Cup in India over security concerns, the Bangladesh government has approved its shooting team's travel to New Delhi, citing the small size of the contingent and the controlled, indoor nature of the event.

Chasing Sincaraz? Novak Djokovic irked by reporter's question at Australian Open Novak Djokovic hits back at a reporter calling a question about chasing Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz as disrespectful. Djokovic entered the Australian Open 2026 semi-final on Wednesday, January 28.

Sarfaraz Khan eyes India comeback with strong IPL season for Chennai Super Kings Sarfaraz Khan believes his IPL stint with Chennai Super Kings can help revive his India ambitions, calling the opportunity to play alongside legends a crucial moment in his career.

Coach Stokes? England captain joins Lions' coaching setup for Pakistan tour: Report Ben Stokes and Moeen Ali will be joining the England Lions backroom staff for their upcoming series against Pakistan Shaheens, according to the latest report. Stokes is recovering from a groin injury he suffered during the Ashes series.

Leave Babar Azam alone: Pakistan captain not worried after poor Big Bash league stint Salman Ali Agha admitted that he is not worried about Babar Azam's form and wants the people to leave him alone after his poor stint in the BBL.

Jyothi Yarraji returns to training after 7 months out due to knee injury India's leading hurdler Jyothi Yarraji has resumed track training after a seven-month injury layoff, confirming her comeback through a YouTube vlog as she begins her build-up toward a crucial 2026 season featuring major international events.

IND vs NZ: In-form Ishan Kishan misses Vizag T20I with niggle, no Shreyas Iyer In-form Ishan Kishan will sit out the Vizag T20I due to a niggle as India decided not to rope in Shreyas Iyer for the contest on Wednesday, January 28.

ICC vs Bangladesh 2.0? Bangladesh cricket board now slams U19 World Cup schedule The Bangladesh cricket board has initiated a new row with the International Cricket Council (ICC), this time with the scheduling for Bangladesh's matches during the ongoing U19 World Cup 2026.

Bangladesh find joy with Women's T20 World Cup berth after men's team setback Bangladesh have qualified for the Women's T20 World Cup after beating Thailand by 39 runs in the qualifiers in Nepal on Wednesday. The Netherlands also secured their berth for the first time in the tournament's history.

UP Warriorz rocked before playoffs with star batter ruled out with injury WPL 2026: Phoebe Litchfield has been ruled out of the tournament due to injury, after which the UP Warriorz roped in Amy Jones as her replacement. The Warriorz are currently struggling at the bottom of the table with two matches left.

India witnessing unprecedented development in sports: President Droupadi MurmuPresident Droupadi Murmu was elated with India securing the hosting rights for the 2030 Commonwealth Games. Murmu credited the Narendra Modi government for aiding the push for sporting culture in the country.

Why Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma's domestic games weren't televised: Devajit Saikia explainsBCCI secretary Devajit Saikia opened up on why Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's matches in the recently-concluded Vijay Hazare Trophy weren't televised. Kohli, back in domestic 50-over cricket after 15 years, hit 131 to become the fastest to 16,000 List A runs. Rohit scored 155 off 94 balls,  raising the tournament's profile.

Djokovic backs Gauff after broadcaster row: Surprised we have no cameras in showerNovak Djokovic backs Coco Gauff after her Australian Open outburst, criticising excessive camera culture and warning about players' lack of privacy. Gauff's outburst video went viral after loss in the quarterfinal.

Jannik Sinner hammers Ben Shelton to set up blockbuster Novak Djokovic semifinalAustralian Open: Jannik Sinner beat Ben Shelton 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 in the quarterfinals and advanced to the semis, where he will lock horns with Novak Djokovic, who has 10 titles to his name at Melbourne Park.

4th T20I Live: Shivam Dube refuses to back down in chaseIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) Live Score: The fearless approach is clearly not working for India with New Zealand's spinners making it a nightmare for India's batters in Vizag.

Joe Root defends Brook's beer smash celebration: No malice, just a joke with usJoe Root has jumped to the defence of Harry Brook's beer-smash celebration during the 3rd ODI against Sri Lanka, saying that it was just light-hearted banter with his teammates. Brook celebrated in Stone Cold Steve Austin style after scoring his hundred against Sri Lanka.

Suryakumar Yadav earns big ranking boost in ideal build-up to T20 World CupIndian captain Suryakumar Yadav has climbed back into the top 10 of the ICC rankings following his impressive showing in the first three T20Is of the five-match series against New Zealand.

Arijit Singh's best moment on cricket field. Ft. Virat Kohli, MS DhoniArijit Singh's announcement of his retirement from film playback singing sparked an emotional response from fans, with old posts from Virat Kohli praising the singer's talent resurfacing online.

The return of Ravi Bishnoi: How tweaked action helped spinner return to his bestFormer World No.1 T20I bowler Ravi Bishnoi fell off the radar last season. Given a chance in the New Zealand T20Is, just before the World Cup, Bishnoi made an epic return with a spell of 4-0-18-2 in the 3rd T20I.

Iceland troll Pakistan for T20 World Cup theatrics: Your replacement is readyIceland Cricket trolled Pakistan amid speculation over a possible T20 World Cup boycott. The post comes as the ICC warns of heavy sanctions if Pakistan attempt a last-minute withdrawal like Bangladesh.

Ajit Pawar plane crash: Sachin Tendulkar mourns Maharashtra Deputy CM's deathSachin Tendulkar has mourned the death of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar after a tragic plane crash. The cricket legend called Pawar a dedicated leader and offered condolences to his family.

Novak Djokovic survives major scare against Lorenzo MusettiAustralian Open: 10-time champion Novak Djokovic survived a major scare against Italy's Lorenzo Musetti on Wednesday, January 28. Ahead by 2 sets, Musseti pulled out of the competition due to a thigh injury.

Tottenham Hotspur and France forward Randal Kolo Muani involved in car crashTottenham forward Randal Kolo Muani was involved in a minor car accident while travelling for Champions League duty. Manager Thomas Frank confirmed the French striker is fine and expected to be available.

India favourites in T20 World Cup, but Dravid warns against one bad day in officeFormer India head coach Rahul Dravid believes that India start as the favourites in the T20 World Cup. However, Dravid has warned that one bad day can undo years of good work.

Are we tennis players or animals in a zoo? Swiatek lashes out at AUS Open broadcastersIga Swiatek has questioned the intense behind-the-scenes coverage at the Australian Open after her quarter-final exit. The world No. 2 backed Coco Gauff's call for more privacy away from the court.

Abhishek Sharma better than Chris Gayle? Former India star's big praise for openerMohammed Kaif has compared Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting to Chris Gayle after his New Zealand onslaught. The former India batter said Abhishek's consistency and instant impact set him apart from most power-hitters.

Time to stop tinkering? Should India play their T20 World Cup XI vs New ZealandIndia have been ringing in the changes in every single game of the New Zealand series so far. While testing the bench strength is needed, the Indian team should be playing their best side at all times just before the T20 World Cup 2026.

4th T20I preview: Sanju Samson seeks a spark as Vizag braces for a stormIndia vs New Zealand, 4th T20I preview: India's marauding T20 machine descends on Vizag for the fourth instalment of what has been a one-sided series so far. Sanju Samson will be in focus as the star opener hopes to find form after an extended training session on Tuesday.

Abhishek Sharma posts new photo, Yuvraj Singh steals show with hilarious tauntYuvraj Singh poked fun at in-form India opener Abhishek Sharma after his latest social media post. The mentor's cheeky comment came as Abhishek continues his blazing run in T20Is.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
